record.dc:title: 66BT2, 15BT2, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Mound. Feature 41, Wall line.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Feature 41, a clay-filled wall line running parallel to the brow of the north primary mound slope. It is .8' in width; up to 1.4' deep; 32 feet of it are traceable, ending in Moore's pit. In the picture the wall fill has been split vertically; width and depth are indicated by incised line. View from southwest.
